channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: Former Kentucky Gov. Martha Layne Collins has died at 88
item.description: LEXINGTON, Ky. (AP) — Martha Layne Collins, the first and only woman elected governor of Kentucky, died on Saturday. She was 88.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Israel says the latest remains returned from Gaza are not bodies of hostages
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The remains of three people Hamas handed over to the Red Cross in Gaza do not belong to any hostages, Israel said Saturday, in the latest setback to the U.S.-brokered ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war.
item.dc:creator: RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Furloughed federal workers face delays getting unemployment pay during shutdown
item.description: Thousands of furloughed federal workers are trying to navigate the unemployment system, in a sharp increase that is still a fraction of the 670,000 furloughed during the shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Mattise, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Andrew's royal exit is the latest crisis for Britain's monarchy
item.description: LONDON (AP) — Holding prestige but not power, Britain’s monarchy is finely tuned to public sentiment.
item.dc:creator: JILL LAWLESS and BRIAN MELLEY, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: FBI raid at Idaho horse track shows how immigration is a top focus across law enforcement
item.description: BOISE, Idaho (AP) — The first sign something was amiss was the thwack of helicopter rotors overhead, followed by screams.
item.dc:creator: REBECCA BOONE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: How does 'doomscrolling' actually affect us? Experts weigh in
item.description: While it may feel relaxing to put one's mind on pause and endless scroll the feed of a favorite app, experts are urging people to beware of certain warning signs.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Tanner, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: New-look Dodgers lineup only produces 4 hits but they come at right time as LA forces Game 7
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — A new-look lineup for the Los Angeles Dodgers only produced four hits in Game 6, but three of them came in a three-run rally off Blue Jays starter Kevin Gausman.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Controversy over Tucker Carlson interview reveals conservative movement's conflict over antisemitism
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — As Republicans accuse Democrats of tolerating antisemitism in their party, the GOP on Friday was roiled by its own schism after the leader of a powerful right-wing think tank defended prominent conservative commentator Tucker Carlson for his friendly podcast interview with a far-righ
item.dc:creator: NICHOLAS RICCARDI, JILL COLVIN and THOMAS BEAUMONT, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Biden immigration policies under fire after illegal immigrant with prior DUIs charged in 14-year-old's death
item.description: An Illegal immigrant with two prior DUI arrests is accused of killing a 14-year-old California student in a hit-and-run crash, highlighting failures in immigration enforcement.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Court says Border Patrol official won't have to brief judge on Chicago-area immigration sweeps
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — An appeals court ruled in favor of the Trump administration Friday and stopped a judge from trying to get daily updates from a Border Patrol official about the government's immigration crackdown in the Chicago area. The court said the order from U.S.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Disney pulls ABC, ESPN and other content from YouTube TV amid breakdown in talks
item.description: YouTube TV viewers can no longer see Disney channels, including ABC and ESPN, after the two sides failed to agree on a new content distribution deal.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: A solid gold toilet is up for auction with a $10 million starting price
item.description: LONDON (AP) — For sale: The world’s most valuable toilet, a lavatory literally worth its weight in gold. Sotheby’s announced Friday that it will auction off the solid gold cistern, a sculpture by Italian artist Maurizio Cattelan entitled “America.
item.dc:creator: JILL LAWLESS Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: DC Mayor Bowser says residents will receive SNAP, WIC benefits in November
item.description: Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser (D) on Thursday said the city will fund the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) and the separate program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) for the month of November amid the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, KRON4

item.title: Jim McGreevey is back on the ballot, 21 years after scandal led him to resign as New Jersey governor
item.description: JERSEY CITY, N.J. (AP) — Two decades after resigning as New Jersey’s governor and stunning the political world as he declared “I am a gay American," Jim McGreevey is back on the campaign trail, running for mayor of the state’s second-largest city.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. SISAK, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Trump says Senate should scrap the filibuster to end the government shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump is calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster, so that the Republican majority can bypass Democrats and reopen the federal government.
item.dc:creator: LISA MASCARO AP Congressional Correspondent, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Man, 39, dies after being pulled from flooded Brooklyn basement: NYPD
item.description: EAST FLATBUSH, Brooklyn (PIX11) — A man died after he was pulled from a flooded basement in Brooklyn as New York City was hit with a historic storm, according to the NYPD. A call came in for a reported person trapped in a flooded basement at 564 Kingston Ave. in East Flatbush at 4:25 p.m.
item.dc:creator: Video credit: Zhané Caldwell, NewsNation

item.title: Suspect in custody after shooting at officers from inside Addison home
item.description: A suspect is in custody after he reportedly fired shots at police officers from inside an Addison home.
item.dc:creator: Ethan Illers, NewsNation

item.title: Vance predicts holiday air travel will be 'a disaster' if shutdown does not end
item.description: Vice President Vance predicted Thursday that holiday air travel will be a “disaster” if the government shutdown does not end. “It could be a disaster,” Vance told reporters following a roundtable at the White House on how the shutdown is impacting airline travel.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, NewsNation

item.title: Maryland state senator indicted in alleged scheme involving filming critic in bed
item.description: Federal prosecutors unsealed criminal charges against a Maryland state lawmaker Thursday, accusing her of blackmailing a political critic by secretly recording them in bed with a married man. State Sen.
item.dc:creator: Zach Schonfeld, WGN 9

item.title: Hegseth plans to give military speech on arms acquisition
item.description: A source told NewsNation that Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth will give a speech on equipment acquisition for "warfighters.
item.dc:creator: Kellie Meyer, NewsNation

item.title: Chicago father of child fighting cancer released on bond by immigration judge
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — A Chicago man whose 16-year-old daughter is undergoing treatment for advanced cancer will be released on bond and return home, an immigration judge ruled Thursday. Attorneys for Ruben Torres Maldonado, a 40-year-old painter and home renovator who was detained Oct.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Vance predicts holiday air travel will be 'a disaster' if shutdown does not end
item.description: Vice President Vance predicted Thursday that holiday air travel will be a “disaster” if the government shutdown does not end. “It could be a disaster,” Vance told reporters following a roundtable at the White House on how the shutdown is impacting airline travel.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Why you won't receive a Supplemental Security check on Nov. 1
item.description: October is nearly over, which means you may be checking your calendar to see when you'll receive your November Social Security benefits.
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, WFLA, NBC

item.title: SNAP scams incoming, expert warns. Here's what to watch out for
item.description: The fast-approaching SNAP benefit freeze could leave millions of Americans vulnerable to scammers, officials and experts are warning.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, KRON4

item.title: The Latest: Trump says he has deals with China after meeting Xi to try to solve trade tensions
item.description: President Donald Trump said he's made deals with China after meeting Chinese leader Xi Jinping on Thursday, the final day of a trip to Asia that was an opportunity for the leaders of the world’s two largest economies to stabilize relations after months of turmoil over trade issues.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Community fights pickleball replacing basketball courts at South Florida beachside park
item.description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. (AP) — Basketball players who frequent a South Florida park feel like they’re being run off in favor of wealthy residents of a new luxury development.
item.dc:creator: DAVID FISCHER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Putin claims Russian troops have surrounded 2 Ukrainian cities but Ukraine says that's not true
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russian President Vladimir Putin claimed Wednesday that Russian troops have surrounded Ukrainian forces in two key eastern cities of Ukraine and offered to negotiate a deal for their surrender. Ukrainian military officials vigorously denied the claim.
item.dc:creator: ILLIA NOVIKOV, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Judge's order blocking removal of man from US wasn't received until after he was deported, DHS says
item.description: NEW ORLEANS (AP) — Immigration authorities did not receive word of a court order blocking the removal of a man living in Alabama until after he had been deported to Laos, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security said Wednesday, dismissing claims that officials violated the order.
item.dc:creator: JIM MUSTIAN and JACK BROOK, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Food aid at risk of expiring as effort to fund SNAP benefits fails in Senate
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Republican leaders in Congress said it’s all or nothing on Wednesday as they rejected a Democratic push to carve out food aid funding for more than 40 million Americans who stand to lose it as part of the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: KEVIN FREKING and MARY CLARE JALONICK, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Cast of popular '80s sitcom to reunite
item.description: One of TV's most famous fictional families is reuniting on stage for the first time in decades, and it's for a cause dear to their hearts.
item.dc:creator: Christine Samra, Fox 5

item.title: Rosie O’Donnell asks for prayers as daughter faces prison sentence
item.description: Rosie O'Donnell is asking her social media followers for prayers as her daughter Chelsea is facing a prison sentence and “scary future.
item.dc:creator: Celeste Houmard, WGN 9

item.title: Federal trial over Trump's National Guard deployment in Portland begins
item.description: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) — A federal trial over whether President Donald Trump can deploy the National Guard to Portland, Oregon, began Wednesday, with a police commander describing on the witness stand how federal agents at a U.S.
item.dc:creator: CLAIRE RUSH and GENE JOHNSON, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: GM lays off 1,700 workers at plants in Michigan and Ohio amid slower EV demand
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — General Motors is laying off about 1,700 workers across manufacturing sites in Michigan and Ohio, as the auto giant adjusts to slowing demand for electric vehicles.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Suspects disguised as construction workers sought in $3.2 million jewelry heist in NYC
item.description: Three people, including two disguised as construction workers, allegedly stole cash and jewelry worth approximately $3.2 million from a home in New York City earlier this month, police said Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Fine, WGN 9

item.title: WWI messages in a bottle found on Australian beach more than 100 years later
item.description: Messages written by two Australian soldiers a few days into their voyage to France during World War I have been found more than a century later.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Video shows dramatic rescue of woman from car submerged in South Carolina pond
item.description: Video obtained by Nexstar's WBTW shows South Carolina first responders and bystanders rescuing a woman from a car partially submerged in a pond along a highway bypass in Horry County Tuesday afternoon.
item.dc:creator: Dennis Bright, Fox 5

item.title: UPS cuts 48,000 jobs in the year to date as its turnaround continues
item.description: United Parcel Service posted third-quarter results that handily beat Wall Street's expectations and gave details about its turnaround efforts, including approximately 48,000 job cuts. Shares rose more than 7% in afternoon trading on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: MICHELLE CHAPMAN, Associated Press, WGN 9
